title: 104_hr637
content: LIMITING ELIGIBILITY OF ALIENS FOR PUBLIC WELFARE ASSISTANCE TO ALIENS PERMANENTLY AND LAWFULLY IN THE UNITED STATES. The text chunk discusses the eligibility of aliens for public welfare assistance, stating that only aliens lawfully admitted to the US for permanent residence are eligible, with an exception for emergency medical assistance. The Attorney General will issue regulations for implementation. The public welfare assistance programs listed include medical assistance, maternal and child health services, community health centers, family planning services, and aid to needy families. The curr_chunk lists various programs under different titles of the Social Security Act and other acts, including aid to needy families, child welfare services, supplemental security income, foster care, adoption assistance, school lunch program, special supplemental food program for women, infants, and children, and nutrition programs for older Americans. The curr_chunk lists various nutrition programs authorized by different acts, including the school breakfast program, child and adult care food program, emergency food assistance program, summer food service program for children, commodity supplemental food program, and special milk program. The curr_chunk lists various housing assistance programs authorized by different acts, including rental assistance, public housing assistance, loan programs, interest reduction payments, and rental assistance payments. The curr_chunk lists housing assistance programs such as rental assistance, assistance payments for homeowners, rent supplement payments for tenants, loan and grant programs for rural dwellings, and loan programs for farm labor housing. The curr_chunk lists various housing assistance programs, including grants for preservation and rehabilitation, mutual and self-help housing loans, site loans, and education-related programs under the Higher Education Act of 1965. The curr_chunk lists education-related programs under the Higher Education Act of 1965, including grants for immunizations, loans, and scholarships for health professions education. The curr_chunk includes various programs established under different acts, such as grants for lead poisoning screening, block grants for preventive health services, and training programs for disadvantaged adults and youth. The curr_chunk lists various training programs for disadvantaged youth and adults established under different acts, including the Job Corps program, summer youth employment programs, and programs under the Older American Community Service Employment Act. The curr_chunk lists various programs established under different acts, including the Low-Income Energy Assistance Act, weatherization assistance program, block grants for social services, Community Services Block Grant Act, Legal Services Corporation Act, and emergency food and shelter grants. The curr_chunk outlines various federal assistance programs, including child care grants, State legalization impact-assistance grants, and notification requirements for program beneficiaries.
